data.title: shakira: Name Meaning, Origin, History, And Popularity
data.meta_description: Shakira is an ancient Arabic name that has found new fame in recent years. Read this post to know more about its significance.
data.text:
In This Article

Origin, Meaning, And History Of Shakira

Shakira is the female version of the name Shakir, which means ‚Äòthankful‚Äô in Arabic. The name is derived from Shakara, an ancient Arabic verb meaning ‚Äòto thank.‚Äô Shakir is used both as a first and last name and is derived from Ash-Shakur, one of the names of God in Islam.

The popularity of the name Shakira grew globally in the early 2000s due to the success of Colombian singer and composer Shakira Isabel Mebarak Ripoll. She is well-known for her musical versatility and has been hailed as the ‚ÄòQueen of Latin Music.‚Äô At age 13, she recorded her first album with Sony Music Colombia. She gained popularity in Hispanic countries with her albums Pies Descalzos and D√≥nde Est√°n los Ladrones. With her sixth album, Laundry Service, she ventured into the English-language music industry and sold over 13 million copies globally. Her hits ‚ÄòWhenever, Wherever‚Äô and ‚ÄòUnderneath Your Clothing‚Äô made her a prominent crossover performer.

The name can also be spelled as Shakirah, Shakeera, or Sakira. Between 1880 and 2018, the name appeared 8,141 times in the SSA public database, with the most reported uses in 2002 when 512 infants were given this name. In 1970, twelve newborns were named Shakira for the first time. In the state of Mississippi, a girl named Shakira rose in popularity in the year 2002.

There is a short film titled Shakira directed by No√©mie Merlant which was released in 2019. Shakira as a character also appears in The Warlord series of comics published by DC Comics. Travis Morgan is the superhero Warlord who fights for the freedom of the people of Skartaris. In this mission, he is supported by Shakira amongst others. The comics series was created by writer-artist Mike Grell and debuted in 1975. One of the stars of the Big Cat Diary documentary series on BBC is a cheetah named Shakira.

How To Pronounce Shakira?

Phonemic Representation Of Shakira

Phonemics is the study of a language‚Äôs distinctive sound units (phonemes), as standardized by the International Phonetics Association. When choosing a name for your baby, knowing its phonemic pronunciation gives an idea about the name‚Äôs sound pattern and auditory appeal. You can assess the name‚Äôs ease of pronunciation, memorability, and softness. Here is the phonemic transcription of Shakira in American and British accents.

In American English: / É…ôÀàk…™r…ô/

In British English: / É…ôÀàk…™…ôr…ô/

Pronunciation of names, in fact, any spoken word, involves the participation of various parts of the mouth, vocal cord, nose, and lungs. Underneath all the sounds we make is the airstream flowing from the lungs and moving up to the mouth. It‚Äôs incredible how lips, tongue, teeth, alveolar ridge, palate, glottis, and larynx work harmoniously to bring out the words. Studies have proved that positive sounds like OM (AUM) help maintain hormonal balance and mental health and reduce stress and anxiety. So, what parts does Shakira trigger? Find the details here; the sound of Shakira might bring in more positive vibes into your life!

Notable People Named Shakira

This section covers people who have made the name Shakira famous with their contributions in various fields. It indeed is a little more inspiration for you to choose the name for your baby, don‚Äôt you think?

ShakiraSinger, songwriter, record producer, dancer, actress, and philanthropist

Shakira BarreraAmerican dancer and actress, best-known for her role in the Netflix series GLOW.

Shakira AustinAmerican basketball player, player for the Washington Mystics of the Women's National Basketball Association (WNBA)

Shakira Ja'nai PayeAmerican actress, well-known for her role in the Comedy Central original sketch series that she created with her comedy troupe along with Paul W. Downs and Lucia Aniello.

Shakira CaineFashion model and actress

Shakira On The Popularity Chart

The name was popular in the early 2000s, due to the pop star Shakira but in recent years it has lost its charm. Take a look at the graphs below to understand this better.

Popularity Over Time

Shakira peaked in popularity during 2002, when 512 babies per million were registered under this name. Since then, the popularity of this name has been declining.

Source:

Rank Over Time

The name managed to stay among the top 1000 names during the late 90s, but in the 21st century it has decreased in rank every year.

Source:

Popularity Within US States

If you're living in the US, you might be curious about the popularity of Shakira in your own state, a state you're considering moving to, or one with which you have a connection. Use the drop-down menu below to select any US state and discover the name's popularity within that region.

Texas

Florida

Shakira Name‚Äôs Presence On Social Media

Before you finalize your baby‚Äôs name, you would want to assess if the name is rare or popular. Digital footprint of the name - it‚Äôs presence on the internet and social media platforms - can provide you with valuable insights on it‚Äôs popularity. A name‚Äôs online presence is an important metric for new parents to evaluate their options and make an informed choice. How many people are searching the name on Google, how many profiles are there on Facebook, does the name have a Wikipedia page? Such information surely tells you if the name is ubiquitous or unique. Here is how Shakira fares on that count.

Anagram Names Of Shakira

William Shakespeare is known for his ‚Äòonomastic wit,‚Äô with anagrams being one of them (remember the play Twelfth Night?). Anagram is the rearrangement of the same letters to form different words. Anagramming names has been in vogue for centuries now, and why not when it can create some cute names? Anagram baby names stand out with their unique sound and spellings. You may try an anagram of your name or your partner‚Äôs; even better if you combine both names and then try an anagram for the baby. It all stays in the family this way. You may also try anagram names for siblings, especially twins. Here are some anagrams of Shakira.

Harsika Kashira Kasirah Raasikh Rashika Rasikha Sakhira Sakirah Shaakir Sharika Arishka Karisha

Shakira‚Äôs Zodiac Sign As Per Western Astrology

Western astrology includes the construction of a horoscope based on the person‚Äôs exact time of birth and location to understand the positions of the planet, stars, and zodiac signs at that time. However, in popular culture, it is often narrowed down to the sun sign, which depends on the person‚Äôs birth date.There are 12 zodiac signs, each having dominant traits, planetary rulers, elemental connection, and more.

Zodiac sign or Sun sign

The Earth‚Äôs orbit around the sun is divided into 12 zodiac signs covering 30-degree sectors. According to Western astrology, the zodiac or sun sign depends on the sun‚Äôs position in one of these sectors at the time of your birth. Starting from the sun‚Äôs position at the March equinox, the chart goes anti-clockwise from Aries, followed by Taurus, Gemini, Cancer, Leo, Virgo, Libra, Scorpio, Sagittarius, Capricorn, Aquarius, and Pisces. These signs are ruled by planetary bodies - Mars, Venus, Mercury, Moon, Sun, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune. Furthermore, they are categorized into triplicities or elemental signs - fire, water, air, and earth - that govern their characteristics. Each of these zodiac signs features certain personality traits that may determine how a person presents themselves.

Each zodiac sign in Western astrology is linked to a specific range of dates in the year. Unlike Vedic astrology, where names can sometimes be used to infer astrological details, Western astrology relies entirely on the birth date.

To know more about your baby‚Äôs zodiac sign, choose the period in which your baby‚Äôs date of birth falls, from the options given below. This will give you a glimpse into the world of astrology tailored for your baby.

Shakira‚Äôs Zodiac Sign And Birth Star As Per Vedic Astrology

Shakira Personality Traits As Per Numerology

The numerology belief system envisages a relationship between a name and numbers. The related numbers are believed to give insights into a person‚Äôs character. We have researched this area to connect the numerology-based characteristic traits to the letters of the English alphabet. And the results are fascinating.

Numerology followers believe that each letter signifies attributes that can influence a person‚Äôs attitude and approach. Among these placements, the most significant are the first letter (Cornerstone) and the last letter (Capstone) of a name. Cornerstone highlights your primary personality traits and explains how you face challenges and opportunities in life. Capstone can tell you about your approach to work and how you complete them. Often, a letter may be repeated twice or more in a name. This repetition signifies the intensification or amplification of the traits associated with the letter in an individual‚Äôs personality.

Read to know what characteristics the name Shakira is known for in numerology. Here we have avoided repetition of letters and added them just once for a better reading experience.

Infographic: Know The Name Shakira‚Äòs Personality As Per Numerology
